title: Family can't sell their home after nearby slaughterhouse flooded it with blood
text:
Homeowner Nick Lestina has been forced to abandon plans to sell his house after it was flooded with animal blood, fat and bones from a slaughterhouse next door (Pictures: WHOTV)

A family have been forced to flee their home after the slaughterhouse next door flooded it with blood, bones and animal fat.

Nick Lestina has had to abandon plans to sell his property in Bagley, Iowa, after waking up to find his basement covered in the foul-smelling red blood of slaughtered pigs and cattle.

Lestina, who has five children, says he’s never had any issues with the slaughterhouse – Dahl’s Custom Meat Locker – until it changed owners recently.

He was appalled to wake up to discover his home filled with blood and entrails – and disgusted when owner Katelyn Dahl told him it wasn’t her company’s problem.

Lestina told WHOTV: ‘They haven’t reached out at all. In fact, they haven’t taken any accountability for it.

‘They say it’s not their fault and told me “good luck.”

‘If I want to do anything about it, it’s on my dime and my schedule.’

The stressed dad added: ‘I’m looking into thousands of dollars with cleanup, over 2,000 just to sanitize the basement.

‘I don’t have thousands of dollars to throw away at this…

‘No one wants to see that, smell that. I wouldn’t want that for anybody in their house.’

Nick Lestina says his family have never had any trouble with the meat locker next door – until it was taken over earlier this year. He now faces a $2,000 cleanup and repair bill (Pictures: WHOTV)

Katelyn Dahl reportedly had the animals killed on October 3, with workers then flushing their blood down a floor drain.

The problem is believed to have occurred because that drain is connected to Lestina’s drain, although it is unclear why the stomach-churning issue has arisen for the first time in a decade.

An Iowa Department of Natural Resources spokesman said the meat locker is cooperating with an investigation, and that they hope Dahl and Lestina can work together to find a solution.
description: Nick Lestina and his family were appalled to find their home in Bagley, Iowa, flooded with the remains of slaughtered pigs and cows
